title: Bug 3666 - CodeCompletion Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)
description:
Bug 3666 - CodeCompletion Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)

Under certain circumstances, the code assist feature eats too much code. This can be reproduced by following these steps:

1. Open the attached class 'X'.
2. In the 'bar' method, add a parameter to the 'baz' call to make the program correct.

Expected Behavior:

The code should be changed to:

baz(x.foo().foo())

Actual Behavior:

The code is changed to:

baz(x.foo()x.foo())

Please note that this issue is caused by the code assist infrastructure and there was an option added to control the behavior, but it has been removed in the latest version. To reproduce the issue, please follow these steps:

1. Change the baz call to 'baz(x.x.foo())'.
2. Place the cursor after the first 'x.'.
3. Press Ctrl+Space to bring up code assist.
4. Type 'f' to filter the list.
5. Select 'foo()'.

This issue should be fixed by restoring the previously added option or finding a suitable solution.

Removing codeassist option.
